semantic_identifier: 5: feat: Filter lifecycle mapping errors from forecasting & lifecycle analytics

sections.text:
## Description

This PR updates forecasting and lifecycle-based analytics aggregations to use only canonical lifecycle values and to exclude any records flagged with lifecycle mapping errors.

Changes:
- Aggregation queries/pipelines now explicitly require a valid canonical lifecycle stage before including a record in:
  - stage-based rollups
  - lifecycle conversion rates
  - slippage/signals derived from lifecycle movement
- Records with mapping error flags (e.g., unmapped CRM stage, missing required mapping fields) are dropped from lifecycle/forecasting inputs rather than falling back to raw CRM stage names.
- Removed/disabled any fallback logic that previously coerced unknown stages into analytics dimensions.

Tests:
- Added regression tests covering mixed inputs (mapped + unmapped/mis-mapped stages) to assert:
  - unmapped/error records are excluded from rollups and rate calculations
  - canonical-only grouping (no raw CRM stage leakage)
  - metrics remain stable when noisy records are present

User impact:
- Lifecycle and forecasting metrics may decrease slightly in environments with unmapped/mis-mapped stages, reflecting removal of previously included noisy records. Fixing stage mappings will restore expected coverage.

## How Has This Been Tested?

staging
